headline: An Argument Of No Crime And No Case
abstract: The president’s legal case would negate any need for witnesses. But constitutional scholars say that it’s wrong.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As President Trump’s impeachment trial opens, his lawyers have increasingly emphasized a striking argument: Even if he did abuse his powers in an attempt to bully Ukraine into interfering in the 2020 election on his behalf, it would not matter because the House never accused him of committing an ordinary crime.
keywords: Trump-Ukraine Whistle-blower Complaint and Impeachment Inquiry
